intro: Pseudodicliptera, commonly known as the false dicliptera, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is characterized by its composite flower heads, which typically consist of both ray and disk flowers. The plants are native to various regions in Africa and are often found in arid or semi-arid environments. They have small, narrow leaves and produce small, often inconspicuous flowers. Pseudodicliptera species are generally herbaceous and may be used in traditional medicine in some parts of their native range.
